item.title: Ticket #755 (Not Found error when >2 static pages) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
After some fiddling with permalinks & htaccess permissions, now everything works.

I'm a little bit puzzled and do not know if the problem was maybe with the cookies, but major puzzle why the 12st two pages worked and not the rest?

However, it looks that this ticket can be closed :-)

Sincerely, Gour

item.title: Ticket #756 (no blog page) updated
item.dc:creator: elliot

item.title: Ticket #756 (no blog page) created
item.dc:creator: elliot
item.description:
blog page empty, php error of PHP Fatal error: Cannot redeclare () (previously declared in ./wp-includes/wp-l10n.php:23) in .wp-includes/wp-l10n.php on line 31

from what I can tell, 23 and 31 are in the same function. the administration side seems to work fine. I have not found anything like this in the forums.

item.title: Ticket #755 (Not Found error when >2 static pages) updated
item.dc:creator: gour

item.title: Ticket #755 (Not Found error when >2 static pages) created
item.dc:creator: gour
item.description:
If one creates more than two static pages, only first two are showed, while for other I get Not Found error.

You can check on ​http://atmarama.org/wordpress/

item.title: Ticket #754 (Usings mysql Booleans) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger

item.title: Ticket #754 (Usings mysql Booleans) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Instead of using enum('Y','N') or enum('0','1') prehaps they should be switch to using a boolean (tinyint(1) that defaults to 0 is the default for a bool).

item.title: Ticket #753 (comment filters get overwritten in functions-post.php) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe

item.title: Ticket #753 (comment filters get overwritten in functions-post.php) created
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description: Filters for new comments are not applied due to a typo overwriting the assignment of $comment in functions-post.php line 437. See attached comment-content-filters.diff

item.title: Changeset [2149]: Use home instead of siteurl.

item.title: Ticket #752 (Adding Category name to Permalink leads to 404 errors) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger

item.title: Ticket #752 (Adding Category name to Permalink leads to 404 errors) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I was testing the following permalink structure in the latest nightly: /%category%/%postname%/ gave me 404 error.

tried adding post number to remove any duplicate post with same name situation. did not work. again 404 error. people on the forum reproduced the problem.

item.title: Ticket #751 (The bundled Textile plugin swallows all Umlauts etc.) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger

item.title: Ticket #751 (The bundled Textile plugin swallows all Umlauts etc.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: The Textile plugin bundled with Wordpress seems to swallow all non-standard characters (like German Umlauts & their friends).

item.title: Ticket #748 (consider adding "Pages" to Dashboard - for easy editing...) updated
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm
item.description:
"Pages" could change a lot when for e.g., if someone wants to maintain "Features", "ToDo" of software that one is writing...

"Pages" looks like the start of Wiki in WordPress :-)

Anyway, an option to see pages or otherwise in the dashboard would solve the issue of cluttering... Users can decide for themselves...

item.title: Ticket #721 (WP should not use cache-control: no-store) updated
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm
item.description:
I was too fast... I got the same behaviour testing "view http request" with my 1.2 WP blog too and this code does not seem to be in 1.5

In the /cache_docs/ page, I thought the statements around "....htaccess files allow web publishers..." would help. Now it is not relevant anymore as the code in wp-blog-header.php is causing the mentioned behaviour.

item.title: Ticket #750 (Page Order on Manage -> Pages) updated
item.dc:creator: trevorturk

item.title: Ticket #750 (Page Order on Manage -> Pages) created
item.dc:creator: trevorturk
item.description: I think that the Page Order field should be included on the overview Manage -> Pages sreen. It would be much-much easier to use there - and it doesn't take up a lot of space anyway. Good cost/benefit, methinks! sweet feature, by the way, i was doing it via mysql.

item.title: Ticket #748 (consider adding "Pages" to Dashboard - for easy editing...) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: i don't think it should be, the dashboard is for stuff that changes a lot - pages probably won't

item.title: Ticket #721 (WP should not use cache-control: no-store) updated
item.dc:creator: Jesse Ruderman
item.description:
A grep of WordPress for 'no-store' has no hits.

slaw% grep no-store * wp-blog-header.php: @header("Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalid ate"); HTTP/1.1

Maybe I just need to upgrade :)

item.title: Ticket #721 (WP should not use cache-control: no-store) updated
item.dc:creator: Jesse Ruderman
item.description:
See ​http://www.mnot.net/cache_docs/

Anything in particular on that page I should pay attention to?

It could be the .htaccess - may be all mentioned websites are hosted at dreamhost ?

squarefree.com is hosted at Dreamhost, but from tracert it looks like the others are not. If Dreamhost has an .htaccess that is applied to all web sites on my shared server, would I be able to view that .htaccess file?

item.title: Ticket #721 (WP should not use cache-control: no-store) updated
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm
item.description: See ​http://www.mnot.net/cache_docs/ - It could be the .htaccess - may be all mentioned websites are hosted at dreamhost ?

item.title: Changeset [2148]: If a category has parents, include those parents when generating the ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: If a category has parents, include those parents when generating the post permalink (if the permalink contains %category%).

item.title: Ticket #748 (consider adding "Pages" to Dashboard - for easy editing...) updated
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm

item.title: Ticket #748 (consider adding "Pages" to Dashboard - for easy editing...) created
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm
item.description:
Greetings,

similar to being able to edit posts,comments from dashboard... consider allowing edit of pages via dashboard too

Cheers, Kishore.

item.title: Ticket #747 (higher-leveled Users can't edit other Users' Pages.) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger

item.title: Ticket #747 (higher-leveled Users can't edit other Users' Pages.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Once a User is at level 5 they can create a Page. A static Page file created by one user at level 5 cannot be edited by another user at level 6 or even level 10.
